column6: PicturePictures are given in relative scales, they're sized to be WYSIWYG when viewing using 81 PPI monitor.
column7: Main features
Thinner (3.3mm), flash only, now up to 512GB, although standard goes up to 128PB since CF 5.0CompactFlash Association announces CF 5.0 standard supporting up to 128 PiB of storage
Thicker (5.0mm), older flash, but usually Microdrive, up to 128 PiB
XQD form factor (38.5 mm × 29.8 mm), PCIe 3.0 x2 (2,0 GB/s), NVMe
PCIe 3.0 x8 (8,0 GB/s), NVMe
Very slim (45.0×37.0×0.76mm), no wear leveling controller, up to 128MB. This particular example shows the write protect sticker (the silver disc).
Slim and small (24×32×1.4mm), up to 16GB
Compact (24×18×1.4mm), up to 16GB
Compact (24×32×1.4mm), swifter, optional DRM, up to 16GB
Subcompact (14×12×1.1mm), optional DRM, 16MB to 4GB
Small (32×24×2.1mm), DRM, up to 4GB. (2GB and 4GB cards use larger block sizes and may not be compatible with some host devices. See Article)
Compact (21.5×20×1.4mm), DRM, up to 4GB. (2GB and 4GB cards use larger block sizes and may not be compatible with some host devices. See Article)
Subcompact (15×11×1mm), DRM, up to 4GB. (2GB and 4GB cards use larger block sizes and may not be compatible with some host devices. See Article)
Same build as SD but greater capacity and transfer speed, 4GB to 32GB (not compatible with older host devices).
Same build as miniSD but greater capacity and transfer speed, 4GB to 32GB. 8GB is largest in early-2011 (not compatible with older host devices).
Same build as microSD but greater capacity and transfer speed, 4GB to 32GB.(not compatible with older host devices)
Same build as SD/SDHC, but greater capacity and transfer speed, 32GB and higher. Standard goes up to 2TB (not compatible with older host devices).
Same build as microSD/microSDHC, but greater capacity and transfer speed, 32GB and higher. Standard goes up to 2TB (not compatible with older host devices).
Same build as SD/SDHC/SDXC, but greater capacity and transfer speed. Standard goes up to 128 TB (not compatible with older host devices).
Same build as microSD/microSDHC/microSDXC, but greater capacity and transfer speed. Standard goes up to 128 TB (not compatible with older host devices)
Slim and narrow (50×21.5×2.8mm), optional DRM, up to 128MB
Slim and narrow (50×21.5×2.8mm), swifter, optional DRM, up to 4GB
Compact (31×20×1.6mm), optional DRM, up to 128MB
Compact (31×20×1.6mm), optional DRM, up to 32GB
Compact (31×20×1.6mm), swifter, optional DRM, up to 32GB
Subcompact (15×12.5×1.2mm), optional DRM, up to 16GB
Subcompact (15×12.5×1.6mm), compulsory DRM, up to 64GB, proprietary (can be used on PS Vita only)
High-capacity, high-speed standard using PCIe as interface
Slim and small (20×25×1.78mm), electrically identical to SmartMedia, no wear-leveling controller, up to 512MBFUJIFILM Global | xD-Picture Card and Adapters
Slim and small (20×25×1.78mm) but slower read/write, no wear-leveling controller, up to 2GB
Slim and small (20×25×1.78mm) and swifter, no wear-leveling controller, up to 2GB

Packages the flash memory, currently soldered in shipping smartphones, into a removable card form factor.  Uses the SCSI command set including queuing. The electrical interface makes use of differential signaling, which enables high bus speeds and robustness under noisy conditions and reduced pin count (compared to parallel bus alternatives such as UHS-I).
Universally compatible across most non-mobile computer platforms, their greater size suits them better to file transfer/storage instead of use in portable devices
